positive.review:
Originally, when my group picked this up, we thought it would be a good one off experience for all us to try. A multiplayer Survivor-like sounds great in paper and we definitely thought, for $10, why not? 

Lo and behold, every single week, we keep coming back to this game, which we affectionately call ‚ÄúLil Wizzies‚Äù. The perfection is in its simplicity ‚Äî a few boards, a bunch of little wizards with different skillsets, endless combinations of builds. 

Do we need some more music and soundscape choices? Sure. Can it benefit from some more bosses and enemy types? Absolutely. But as an early access game for $10 that keeps adding onto the roadmap? To say it‚Äôs worth every penny is truly an understatement.
Great game to play on the Steam Deck. Well worth the money with amount of content already existing, but also with the regular updates we get for this game.

i love this game. if you enjoy vampire survivors type gameplay this has a bunch of stuff you'll like and getting to play with others is very fun. The matchmaking works great to play with strangers if you don't have friends set up and the chat is using hotkeys so there isn't any ego to deal with. I'd imagine it would be fun to play with friends and laugh at each other. To play with Friendly Fire off, you need to select a Covenant which is an empty bubble at the bottom right when you get ready to match make. It took me a bit to figure it out but there are lots of people who play without being able to hurt each other. 
I really look forward to this game progressing and playing more!

The Spell Brigade is an incredibly well designed survivors-like game with online co-op (which is currently rare for the genre). It has excellent netcode (client side hit detection) so that non-host players don't feel like they're at a disadvantage. You can choose from a wide selection of characters that each have their own traits and starting spells, and each spell can be augmented with elements for even more build variety.

I highly recommend this game for anyone looking for a survivors-like that stays true to the formula while also offering excellent online co-op!

Normal modes don't feel difficult enough even on max difficulty, and endless can easily become ridiculously easy once you max out dodge and/or get the right upgrades along the way that let you constantly regenerate massive amounts of hp. The only time the game is actually hard is if you are playing with 4 people and friendly fire is on, and you're on a hard difficulty on a hard map. The problem is, I don't know the solution to this problem, or even if there is one. More environmental hazards is lame, and simply throwing more enemies, or spongier enemies, at you doesn't seem like the right call. 

It's a cool idea for a game but I wouldn't recommend it unless this 'genre' of game is your absolute favorite. I'm not even sure what genre this would be... roguelike arena?

It's fun with friends and not a bad game but unfortunately also very frustrating.
Many mechanics seem ill-conceived and rng doesn't feel as good as in other similar games.
The maps are static and your arsenal isn't very divers so it get's stale rather fast.

Couple of examples:
[spoiler]Some enemies spawn as fast moving walls in intervals and if your position is unlucky you're just screwed.
One boss massively restricts the arena and also occasionally alters your movement. That's makes avoiding enemies really hard and overall a very frustrating boss encounter.
Some elemental enchantments are counterproductive: Dark converts enemies, causing your spells to not target them anymore but you still take full damage when colliding with those converted enemies.
On each lvl-up the games pauses and the screen darkens. So you can't see the mobs anymore and if that happens while you're within a mob-group it'll certainly cause the occasional death.
How each stat works isn't explained at all. Is armor flat or percentage? Is bonus xp just for you or your team?
Also some stats feel pretty useless like liferegen for example. And in general the balance is way off.[spoiler]

But it's still early access, so maybe it'll improve over time. But right now, if it weren't for my friends i wouldn't play it.

Pretty easy and fun survivors game on the lowest difficulty. A bit unplayable on the highest difficulty. 

The game is balanced around weapon augments that you get from completing objectives that periodically appear, but some objectives are order of magnitudes harder than others. The game is probably balanced around the lowest difficulty, but the highest difficulty is probably unplayable. Playing as duo, I probably spent 3 hours on the first 5-10 minutes of the highest difficulty without being able to complete both of the first objectives. 

The game has a lot of potential, but I would claim the balancing is not quite there yet.

It's fun with friends and not a bad game but unfortunately also very frustrating.
Many mechanics seem ill-conceived and rng doesn't feel as good as in other similar games.
The maps are static and your arsenal isn't very divers so it get's stale rather fast.

Couple of examples:
[spoiler]Some enemies spawn as fast moving walls in intervals and if your position is unlucky you're just screwed.
One boss massively restricts the arena and also occasionally alters your movement. That's makes avoiding enemies really hard and overall a very frustrating boss encounter.
Some elemental enchantments are counterproductive: Dark converts enemies, causing your spells to not target them anymore but you still take full damage when colliding with those converted enemies.
On each lvl-up the games pauses and the screen darkens. So you can't see the mobs anymore and if that happens while you're within a mob-group it'll certainly cause the occasional death.
How each stat works isn't explained at all. Is armor flat or percentage? Is bonus xp just for you or your team?
Also some stats feel pretty useless like liferegen for example. And in general the balance is way off.[spoiler]

But it's still early access, so maybe it'll improve over time. But right now, if it weren't for my friends i wouldn't play it.
Repetitive, low replayability, boring, slow.
